title: Oce Server and toxicity
body:
Yo, I'm not here to rant about whole heap of stuff but I just wanted to hear your opinions.
Recently, I hopped back onto league after a month and a bit (Post exam) and things seemed not much different.
Then, you know, as league players, we have games where we do really well, and games where we do really bad, right?
Whenever I pulled off poor performance, people wouldn't really care or give small insults which I never cared about.
But now, if I was to do some bad stuff, as in not playing so well, then so many people just adds me after the game to continue flaming.
I'm legit concerned about all those people because they obviously take this game so seriously, don't you reckon?  Bahaha
Just recently, I reckon, this server got more toxic and all that, so I'm just thinkin to myself that the punishments should be a lil' harsher.
Just my own thought,
Have a nice day ya'll!

EDIT: Oh I also forget to explain that when I say taking this game 'seriously', I meant it as more of a 'personal' and 'offensive' way. Like let's say whenever a jungler fails a gank, the response is usually 'Go f***ing hang yourself' or 'Hope you get a ca***r'. I don't think it's right to flame anybody with some stuff (If you know what I mean) regardless of how mad you are. I mean, the most common one I heard was about somebody hoping the other to get cancer, like I don't even find that funny.

Mind me, I think one of the rules for this discussion page is to never quote any summoner's names. I'm not sure if the Riot employees have seen this but make sure to be careful I reckon. But bruh, heads up! You'll climb, don't worry c:

OCE is nowhere near as toxic as NA.

As for people taking the game seriously, many gamers take their game of choice seriously, especially if they have some sort of connection with it.

And why not take a game seriously?
People take sports and other hobbies seriously.
There is no reason to not treat gaming the same what so ever.

Taking a game serious and being a serious asshole, now there is a difference.

I can't speak much for S5, I only got back into the game in S5 and played little ranked, but back in S3/4 the players at a higher rank were not so bad, the lower players were still pretty toxic, but moving forward to S6, from what I see so far, the lower ranked players are toxic little shits, some of them do state along the lines that they have made an investment or some shit, the usual "I put $200 into this game" rubbish and think they are owed the world and can rightly so abuse all other players as they are 'paying customers'.

I have been here for 5 years, put hundreds into this game, possibly even thousands. I cannot check that far back, hell, I can't even check when I purchased my Project: Yi skin and that is very recent since they came out. Yet I think no matter what, it is a FREE game that you can play at par with EVERYONE if your skill level dictates simply because all the stuff you 'buy' with RP that you cannot get for free is just a cosmetic item that means nothing in the long run.

Sure Riot needs that money to function, and sure I am happy to help pay my way for the service they offer, but players need to stop thinking that just because they have been here for years or spent $X that they deserve anything. Taking the game serious is one thing, being a C*** about it is another.

Riot needs to do something about those players who are toxic, there are many players who don't complain, they simply say "I have had enough" and leave without notice. But like OP, I am one that will continue the fight against these assholes and keep at it until more people start realising that something needs to be done.

I have noticed a sever decrease in total %%%%s over the past six or so months.

Riot have been doing their job, there are less abusive people.
Just because the vocal majority says otherwise, doesn't mean that nothing is being done.

Than come onto my account and see the shit I get.

Just last game I had a jungler who never ganked mid, period. I had both bot opponents and jungle in my lane, I inevitably lost my lane and was blamed by the jungler for the whole teams lose, constant abuse about how bad I was.

I went 1/8, bot lane went 1/5 and 1/6, but nothing said about them losing their tower first, nothing about them not roaming, nothing about them only getting 1 kills each or the Malphite top who was never with the team, just abuse about myself.

He even admitted to not ganking my lane and told me I should be able to hold them when they ganked me, than abused me when I died to 4 of them.

Every single ranked game, even in the ones I do the best out of my team and actually carry my team, I get grouped with premade assholes who only want to complain about those not on their team and blame them for the lose or when something doesn't go their way.

And in case you think I am talking shit, here was the AD and Support from my last game, premade:
http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=upaios - AD (5/15 W/L)
http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=moooomaek - Support (7/13 W/L)

Take away my bot and custom games and I have a 12/8 W/L over the last 20 games.

Players don't give 2 shits about anything, they see your KDA, they see your lane opponents KDA and start with the abuse. I had an Ekko recently who got some 16 of his 21 kills during the game against my team, but it was my fault for feeding him 2 kills in the first 15 minutes, yeh, feeding. I was being blamed for feeding him with only 2 kills.

Before we get into this, I am a jungle main, yet I like to remain as unbiased as possible.

The jungler is not obligated to gank.
Especially if you fall behind.
Ask any high tier jungler and they will tell you that it's better to snowball a winning lane, it's far more efficient and easier than trying to save a lost lane.

First and foremost you must work on your OWN ability to play the game, pay no attention to anyone else in the match.
You seem to be a Mid Lane main, so how does a mid laner get better?
CS.
Focus on your creep score above all else, aim for 200 by 25 minutes.
Once you reach that, learn how to better zone your opponent while maintaining that decent CS.
Controlling your CS and your opponent's CS is a major part of mid lane more than any other lane.
While CS is important, you must also make sure you have wards in the right place, while ensuring that your opponent doesn't know where you warding so they can't counter your ward placement.

>WARDS PREVENT GANKS! WARDS SAVE LIVES!

Get a pink, it's only 75g you can hold off on that Needlessly Large a little longer if this pink saves you from a gank.
Pay attention to who your lane opponent is, are they a champ that typically relies on ganks to start snowballing?
What about their jungler, who is it, when does that champ start ganking.

Quick scenario:
You're Ahri{{champion:103}} , opponent is Talon{{champion:91}} .
Your jungler is Rek'Sai{{champion:421}}  theirs is Rengar{{champion:107}}.
Talon has a hard time early against Ahri, she's going to be forcing Talon to back away from the creep and he'll fall behind in CS, he'll get a {{item:3155}} making it a bit harder for Ahri to harass and close the deal on an engage.
You can call to Rek'Sai for a gank, but Rek'Sai is a champ that likes to gank top and bot lane due to her tunnels being more favourable there, you know Rengar wont be ganking until level 6 so you can be patient while asking for a gank.
You ward bot side jungle entrance with your trinket while keeping the pink you bought for that dreadful moment where Talon ults and Rengar ganks so that you can reveal them.
If this happens you can keep Talon and Rengar off you long enough for your Rek'Sai to come help, or keep them off you long enough that they lose more than they gain by ganking you.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Exactly what I tell my team every game.
Please buy a goddam pink and put in our jungle because it's perma and cheap!

I have read posts like your's a million times, what still stands is this:

1 - The jungler is not responsible for saving a lane
2 - The jungler has no right to complain for anyone losing a lane if they refuse to counter gank

That is ALL that stands. If you lose lane on your own in a 1v1 situation, that is your fault and your fault only, if you lose when getting ganked, sometimes you are to blame, depending on the situation, a few ganks from the enemy jungler and that is still your fault.

However, what I was experiencing was a bot lane duo who have one of the worst records of games played I have seen, no pings, period, no roaming, and losing their lane faster than myself even with our jungler ganking for them. I than had our jungler refuse to help me for WHATEVER reason, yet still complain when I was losing lane to 4 of them.

No matter how many wards I were to place, no matter how defensive I was to play, the simple fact is this: You CANNOT defend against 4 players, you cannot survive against 4 players, the only way you are going to do so is if you actually leave your lane and retreat. Even under your tower means nothing in a 1v4 situation.

I am not complaining about losing my lane, I am complaining about the asshat jungler who refused to help me, than blame me for the entire lose of the game, It is a so called team game, not a "it's your fault" game. Some players need to look at what is ACTUALLY happening in game and shut the fuck up. Blaming me for losing a lane when I was at times 1v4 while bot lane was actually doing worse WITH help, that is what gets me.

The point still stands that you are focusing far too much on someone else's gameplay instead of your own.

In that situation the jungler was probably with the bot lane pre-made.

No he wasn't actually premade with them, they were just the duo.

And no, you are missing the point.

I have an ass in the bronze ranks as I do in most games, as I did again last game, who instead of doing what needs to be done, or shutting the fuck up, would go about blaming me for losing a lane that was sometimes 1v4.

Top never roamed, bot never roamed, pinged, or anything really, and jungler refused to gank my lane, yet our jungler, who had the best chance of helping me since he is roaming anyways, blamed me for the lose instead of realising that I was sometimes in a 1v4 situation.

My point, since you don't get it, is that at the depths of ranked you get assholes who just play the blame game instead of realising what was actually going on. It is just so that this time I had the jungler and you decided to yet again lecture me on how the jungler works, which is also typical of this community in that assuming players who make complaints are just bad and need to be lectured or taught how to play.

I try to make a point that there are assholes who simply play the blame game instead of either helping, or if they can't help, shutting the fuck up and realising that when someone loses lane it is not always that persons fault. There are a raft of issues why from being over ganked, to being counter picked, to being matched against a smurf.

I will say it again, come into my games and see the shit I get. Last game I had a Pantheon going 1v5 and yet again playing the blame game, not just with me because I actually had the least deaths, decent kills and most damage and CS.

In the after game it went a little something like this:
Panth: "Bronze 5 forever"
Me (Malz): eh, Panth, you didn't play too well (he was regularly trying to 1v5 just to get a kill on a low health enemy or chasing halfway across the jungle)
Panth: "same" (in response to me telling him he was not playing well)
Panth: "Who fed Ekko?"
ME: I didn't, I had the least deaths
Ekko: No one fed me
Panth: Who ulted Sion?
...
And it went on, instead of realising he was over chasing, went 1v5 a few times and was never really playing as a team, all he done was look at whoever else and try to blame them and pick at them for why he lost a match he did not deserve to lose.

He targeted at me because I was the only one left in team chat that was actually saying something and he knew he was going to get a response. But when the responses he got did not vindicate the reasoning as to why we lost the game, instead of accepting the fact he was part of the reason we lost, he simply said "Don't talk shit, u suck" and left. Which is very typical of a low rank player, if they cannot get what they want they will just ramble nonsensical shit and leave.
This one is true, yes.

Yeah, I mean even spending so much on a 'game' that will eventually disappear might be a too much for some people. Like you could've spent all that money for 'better' purposes like gifting your parents or taking care of your family and go out and socialise you know. C:
But yeah, with your opinion, I do agree that people shouldn't think that they deserve more and what not only because of their contribution to this game most time-wise and money-wise.

I do agree with your opinion actually, Klavinmour. 
People may take game seriously, just like how people take their hobbies and sports seriously. 
But then again, even out of those people who take sports and hobbies seriously, there are people who're toxic and unsportsmanlike. For example, I personally played representative basketball for a long period of time and I've faced up to a lot of different individuals. A large number of them were nice and sportsmanlike, apologising for any accidents and unintentional fouls. However, there were those who continuously trash talked and intentionally fouled and what not. I took basketball seriously (which was my hobby), because I wanted to win and I wanted to try hard. But things got difficult when people started being toxic and unsportsmanlike, even worse when you have your teammate insult your about your performance.
I guess it's the same for this game. I want to win and climb because I somewhat take this game seriously too to a certain level. However, things become extremely challenging when players on your team becomes toxic and excessively salty.

I mean, put it this way. Wouldn't it be more accurate that those who take this game seriously should know that being toxic and salty will not get them any further up higher, but put themselves on tilt and elo hell?

Even though being toxic and taking game seriously may sound like they have a strong connection in between them, I think it's important to realise that taking this game seriously would only make you a passionate player, whereas being toxic and salty would only make you an asshole and an unsportsmanlike player to everyone's eyes (As well as being competitive and serious).
